file_content.text: The doctors say they should be able to clear up his head wound. He'll be right as rain in no time.
You there. Where's my ship? Need to get back up there. Battle won't win itself, you know.
Uh, the battle? Oh--I see! The Battle of Hoth. Of course. Uh... that's fine. Let's get you checked up first. All right?
Thank you for taking me seriously and going out there. Even though he does seem a bit... confused.
Glad I could help out.
He probably sustained a head wound when his ship went down. And he's been out there a long time.
That's not surprising.
I suppose. He's with us now, though. That's the main thing.
Hey--I'm the best.
Indeed you are.
Seems like a lot of trouble for one man, I know, but he's a hero. He deserved more than being left to freeze to death.
The medics will check him out. You never know--he might actually fight again.
You should hurry. The reports say a fierce storm is on its way.
Are you the group giving the Empire a hard time? I was told you might pass through.
Master Jedi! Finally! I was told you might pass through the outpost.
Captain. I was told you might pass through, but I was starting to lose hope.
Excuse me. Are you the freelancer who's been giving the Empire a hard time?
Thank the stars! I was told you might pass through the outpost, but I was beginning to lose hope.
I'm Cedin Kavil--communications officer. I need your help to rescue a war hero.
Pilot First Class Darkil Aro was shot down during the Battle of Hoth. He's been lost for years out there in the wastelands.
How did this pilot manage to stay alive? This is one of the harshest planets in the galaxy.
And he survived?
I can't say I know his name.
Who was he?
Rescuing soldiers isn't really my job.
Sorry, my mission is urgent.
Darkil is no ordinary soldier. He single-handedly took down an Imperial battle cruiser. Saved us from losing the war.
I've been doing a grid-by-grid search of the ice fields in my spare time, searching for wreckage. It's... sort of a hobby.
I located an emergency beacon broadcasting Darkil's digital tag and active life signs. I've told Command, but they say we can't spare the resources.
It does sound like he might still be alive.
You might be onto something.
He is. And we need to bring him back.
You're putting a lot of effort into this. Is he family?
This seems... personal.
No. My father was a pilot. Killed in action. I... didn't have the skills to follow him.
It's a lot of effort for one man, no matter how special you think he is.
Command is right.
No--you're wrong!
This man destroyed an enemy no one else could, and we left him on this planet for years... we owe it to him to attempt a rescue!
This pilot deserves full honors for taking part in that battle. I'll do it.
I agree.
Your words are wise, Cedin. This pilot is an example to us all.
You're right.
Darkil deserves every effort to find him. No matter what Command says, I'll rescue this pilot.
Count me in.
I've spent my fair share of time chasing credits. Guess I can help someone else out for a change.
You're right.
Fine, fine. I'll do it.
Thank you! If I had even half the skills of my father, I'd be out there with you. But... I guess you help out where you can.
Here are the coordinates. Good luck, and be careful.
Can't help. [Refuse quest]
Then I'm sorry for wasting your time. I suppose he'll just have to stay out in the wastelands.
Please--don't disturb me. I'm collating some search data.
